item.title: Vulkan + Mesa Drivers For AI Inferencing? It's Already Showing Potential On Radeon RADV
item.description: Following the Vulkanised 2025 presentation how NVIDIA is finding great success with Vulkan for AI / machine learning and already competitive to CUDA in some areas, Red Hat engineer and DRM subsystem lead maintainer David Airlie began exploring the potential of Mesa Vulkan drivers for AI inferencing. He was successful in using the Intel ANV, NVIDIA NVK, and Radeon RADV drivers for Vulkan-based AI inferencing while for the Radeon hardware tested is where it's showing the most potential (performance) at the moment and for even competing with the ROCm compute stack...

item.title: New AMD Linux Driver Ushers In Seamless Firmware Servicing "SFS"
item.description: A new Linux driver patch series posted by AMD today introduces a new kernel driver "SFS" for Seamless Firmware Servicing. I hadn't heard AMD talk about Seamless Firmware Servicing at any previous events but it appears to be supported for current-generation AMD EPYC 5th Gen "Turin" processors...

item.description:
NYC Crypto suspects William Duplessie and John Woeltz have secured $1 million bail while the court reviews claims they bound, shocked, and threatened a 28-year-old SoHo man to seize his Bitcoin. Mayor Eric Adams’ detail faces scrutiny after two officers allegedly drove the victim to the townhouse.
